solution_line_template: On the second day, the company paved {first_day_miles} * {second_day_multiplier} - {second_day_subtract} = <<{first_day_miles}*{second_day_multiplier}-{second_day_subtract}={second_day_miles}>>{second_day_miles} miles.
The company has {total_miles} - {second_day_miles} - {first_day_miles} = <<{total_miles}-{second_day_miles}-{first_day_miles}={remaining_miles}>>{remaining_miles} miles of road remaining to pave.

They will need {truckloads_per_mile} * {remaining_miles} = <<{truckloads_per_mile}*{remaining_miles}={needed_truckloads}>>{needed_truckloads} truckloads of asphalt to pave {remaining_miles} miles of road.

For {needed_truckloads} truckloads, they will need {needed_truckloads} * {bags_gravel_per_truckload} = <<{needed_truckloads}*{bags_gravel_per_truckload}={total_bags_gravel}>>{total_bags_gravel} bags of gravel.

Thus, the company will need {total_bags_gravel} / {gravel_per_pitch_ratio} = <<{total_bags_gravel}/{gravel_per_pitch_ratio}={barrels_pitch}>>{barrels_pitch} barrels of pitch to finish the road on the third day.
